overview.title: Overview
overview.p1: This is a web-based tool designed to accelerate the application design and architecture phase for OutSystems developers. By uploading a multi-page PDF exported from a design tool like Figma, this application uses the Google Gemini API to analyze the visual and textual content and generate a comprehensive solution architecture blueprint.

figma.title: 1. Exporting from Figma
figma.p1: For the best analysis results, you must export your design from Figma as a single, multi-page PDF file.
figma.step1: In Figma, select all the frames you want to include in the analysis.
figma.step2: Go to the main menu: File > Export frames to PDF...
figma.step3: This will generate a single PDF file where each frame is a separate page.
figma.step4: Save this consolidated PDF file to your computer.

apiKey.title: 2. Setting Up Your API Key
apiKey.p1: The application requires a Google Gemini API key to function. When you first open the application, a pop-up will appear asking for your API key. Paste your key into the input field and click "Save". The key will be stored in your browser's local storage for future visits. You can update your key at any time by clicking the key icon in the header.

analyze.title: 3. Analyzing Your Design
analyze.step1: Click the "Choose PDF File" button and select the PDF you exported from Figma.
analyze.step3: Wait for the analysis to complete. The full architecture blueprint will be displayed.

features.title: Features & Analysis Sections
features.p1: The AI generates a detailed report broken down into the following sections:
features.bizSummary: A high-level summary of the application's purpose.
features.architecture: Categorizes modules into the OutSystems 3-Layer Canvas (End-User, Core, Foundation).
features.erd: An interactive, visual diagram of your data model.
features.entities: A detailed table view of all data entities and their attributes.
features.staticEntities: Lookup data or enumerations, like order statuses or user types.
features.async: Recommendations for background processes (Timers and BPT) if needed.
features.thirdParty: Suggestions for external services like payment gateways or cloud storage.
features.api: A list of proposed REST API endpoints for your application.
features.pages: A list of all identified screens or pages.
features.siteProperties: Global, configurable variables for your application.
features.export: The entire report can be exported as a professionally formatted PDF, and the ERD can be exported as a PNG.
